snippet: An economist suggests that so-called budget sequestration — government spending cuts — could actually help the nation’s economy, if the right kind of cuts are made.
abstract: Tyler Cowen Economic View column suggests that impending budget sequestration--government spending cuts--could actually help nation’s economy; contends that most cuts should proceed on schedule, though with some restructuring along the way; calls for military and Medicare budget cuts.
lead_paragraph: An economist suggests that so-called budget sequestration — government spending cuts — could actually help the nation’s economy, if the right kind of cuts are made.

headline.print_headline: Nips, Tucks And Big Budget Cuts
headline.seo: Budget Sequestration: How to Do It Right
headline.main: Nips and Tucks and Big Budget Cuts
